wikipedia_page.main: Albert Goodwin (2 August 1906 – 22 September 1995) was a Fellow of Jesus College, Oxford (where he had previously been a student) and later Professor of Modern History in the University of Manchester. In his book of the same name, he presented his liberal interpretation of the French Revolution as 'a merciless conflict between aristocracy and democracy' caused by the refusal of Louis XVI to accept the role of a constitutional monarch.

response: * Prof Albert Goodwin (1906–95), Professor of Modern History at the University of Manchester from 1953–69
Albert Goodwin (1887–1918) was a Canadian trade unionist.
